member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.Body1
member.summary: The first body linked by this joint.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.Body2
member.summary: The second body linked by this joint.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.ContactsEnabled
member.summary: Setting this to True will allow the joined bodies to contact each other. Setting to False will cause the object to freely intersect without influencing each other.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.Name
member.summary: Name of the joint.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.BreakMaxForce
member.summary: Defines how much force this joint can take on specified axis before breaking. 0 means it is not breakable.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.BreakMaxTorque
member.summary: Defines how much torsion force can be applied to this joint before breaking. 0 means it is not breakable.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.RelatedMotors
member.summary: Can return null. Don't change list.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.BaseAxis.LimitsEnabled
member.summary: Enables you to use LimitHigh and LimitLow if set to True. If set to False above limits will not be taken into account.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.BaseAxis.LimitsRestitution
member.summary: Controls the amount of bounce when the joint hits a limit. A restitution value of 1.0 causes the joint to bounce back with the velocity which it hit the limit. A value of zero causes the joint to stop dead.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.BaseAxis.LimitsDamping
member.summary: If spring is greater than zero, this is the damping of the limit spring.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.BaseAxis.Direction
member.summary: Specifies direction of the axis.

member.name: M:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.RotationAxis.IsDesiredVelocitySupported
member.summary: Supported only by ODE.

member.name: M:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.RotationAxis.SetDesiredVelocity(Engine.MathEx.Radian,System.Single)
member.summary: Supported only by ODE.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.RotationAxis.LimitLow
member.summary: Determines the bottom limit for movement on this axis.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.RotationAxis.LimitHigh
member.summary: Determines the upper limit for movement on this axis.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.TranslationAxis.LimitLow
member.summary: Determines the bottom limit for movement on this axis.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Joint.TranslationAxis.LimitHigh
member.summary: Determines the upper limit for movement on this axis.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.BallJoint.Anchor
member.summary: Specifies the point where the two bodies are attached.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.BallJoint.Axis1
member.summary: Specifies first rotational axis this joint.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.BallJoint.Axis2
member.summary: Specifies second rotational axis this joint.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.BallJoint.Axis3
member.summary: Specifies third rotational axis this joint.

member.name: T:Engine.PhysicsSystem.BallJoint.PhysX_Drive
member.summary: Used to specify which axes of a joint are driven.
member.remarks: Each drive is an implicit force-limited damped spring: force = spring * (target position - position) + damping * (targetVelocity - velocity) Alternatively, the spring may be configured to generate a specified acceleration instead of a force. A linear axis is affected by drive only if the corresponding drive flag is set. There are two possible models for angular drive: swing/twist, which may be used to drive one or more angular degrees of freedom, or slerp, which may only be used to drive all three angular degrees simultaneously.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.BallJoint.PhysX_Drive.X
member.summary: Drive along the X-axis.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.BallJoint.PhysX_Drive.Y
member.summary: Drive along the Y-axis.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.BallJoint.PhysX_Drive.Z
member.summary: Drive along the Z-axis.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.BallJoint.PhysX_Drive.Swing
member.summary: Drive of displacement from the X-axis.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.BallJoint.PhysX_Drive.Twist
member.summary: Drive of the displacement around the X-axis.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.BallJoint.PhysX_Drive.Slerp
member.summary: Drive of all three angular degrees along a SLERP-path.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.ShapeType
member.summary: The shape type of the shape.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.Name
member.summary: Name of the shape.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.Position
member.summary: The position of the shape in body space, i.e. relative to the body they are owned by.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.Rotation
member.summary: The rotation of the shape in body space, i.e. relative to the body they are owned by.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.MaterialName
member.summary: Template material lists provide easy configuration of physics properties. Available are: Metal, Wood, Rubber and Ice. You can specify new materials in the Data\\Base\\Constants\\PhysicsSystem.config.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.Hardness
member.summary: Defines how resistant is the object to shape changes when force is applied. Affects on ODE physics only.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.StaticFriction
member.summary: Defines the static friction of the shape. This type of friction occurs between two objects that do not move relatively to each other.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.DynamicFriction
member.summary: Defines the dynamic friction of the shape. This type of friction occurs when two objects are moving relatively to each other and influence each other.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.Restitution
member.summary: Defines the coefficient of restitution of the material. Value range is from 0 to 1 and the higher it is the more bouncy will the shape be.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.Density
member.summary: Density has direct influence on the object's mass.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.SpecialLiquidDensity
member.summary: Special density used only in calculation for water buoyancy.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.VehicleDrivableSurface
member.summary: Determines if the vehicles can move over the surface.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Shape.Contact
member.summary: If set to True, the shape will be able to come into contact with other shapes. Setting this to False will cause the object to pass through other object with no interaction.

member.name: M:Engine.PhysicsSystem.MeshShape.GetData(Engine.MathEx.Vec3[]@,System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: Don't modify out data.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.MeshShape.MeshName
member.summary: Path to mesh file that will be used as collision mesh.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.MeshShape.MeshScale
member.summary: Scale of current mesh.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.MeshShape.MeshType
member.summary: Specifies the type of internal mesh shape. TriangleMesh type can be used only for static bodies. In case of dynamic bodies the physics engine can work only with convex-hull shapes. For dynamic bodies is possible to choose ConvexHull and ConvexHullDecomposition, the latter of which means that the body will automatically be divided into multiple convex-hulls.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.MeshShape.ConvexHullDecompositionMaxTriangles
member.summary: Used for convex hull decomposition type only. Specifies the targeted number of triangles of the decimated mesh.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.MeshShape.ConvexHullDecompositionMaxVerticesPerConvexHull
member.summary: Used for convex hull decomposition type only. Specifies the maximum number of vertices for each generated convex-hull.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.MeshShape.PerTriangleMaterial.MaterialName
member.summary: Template material lists provide easy configuration of physics properties. Available are: Metal, Wood, Rubber and Ice. You can specify new materials in the Data\\Base\\Constants\\PhysicsSystem.config.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.MeshShape.PerTriangleMaterial.StaticFriction
member.summary: Defines the static friction of the shape. This type of friction occurs between two objects that do not move relatively to each other.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.MeshShape.PerTriangleMaterial.DynamicFriction
member.summary: Defines the dynamic friction of the shape. This type of friction occurs when two objects are moving relatively to each other and influence each other.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.MeshShape.PerTriangleMaterial.Restitution
member.summary: Defines the coefficient of restitution of the material. Value range is from 0 to 1 and the higher it is the more bouncy will the shape be.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.MeshShape.PerTriangleMaterial.VehicleDrivableSurface
member.summary: Determines if the vehicles can move over the surface.

The maximum torque the motor can exert.
If true, motor will not brake when it spins faster than target velocity.
The gear ratio for the drive.

member.summary: Name of the body.

member.summary: Determines if this object will be dynamic and be affected by gravity or completely static and non-moving.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.Shapes
member.summary: List of current shapes attached to physics body. Don't change items of the array.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body._ShapesAsListForEditor
member.summary: List of current shapes attached to physics body.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.Position
member.summary: Position of the body in the world.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.Rotation
member.summary: Rotation of the body in the world.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.Sleepiness
member.summary: Determines how responsive this object is in the game world before falling into 'sleep' state by physics engine.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.LinearDamping
member.summary: Linear damping coefficient. Determines how quickly this body should return to a state of rest when moving.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.AngularDamping
member.summary: Angular damping coefficient. Determines how quickly this body should return to a state of rest when moving.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.CCD
member.summary: Continuous collision detection. CCD is a method of calculating collision especially useful for small, fast moving objects.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.MassMethod
member.summary: Specifies how this bodies mass in the world is determined (manually by developer or by density).

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.Mass
member.summary: Current mass of the body.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.CenterOfMassAuto
member.summary: When this option is enabled the center of mass will calculated automatically. By default the center of mass coincides with the body position. It is supported only on PhysX.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.CenterOfMassPosition
member.summary: Get or sets the position of the center of mass of the body.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.CenterOfMassRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of the center of mass of the body.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.Body.InertiaTensorFactor
member.summary: Gets of sets the multiplier to calculate the inertia tensor of the body. NVIDIA PhysX only.

member.summary: Can return null. Don't change list.

member.summary: Can return null. Don't change list.

member.summary: Determines if this body is affected by world gravity or ignores it completely.

member.summary: Number of position iterations the solver should perform for this body.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.AttractorMotor.Exponent
member.summary: The one of parameters of the calculation gravitational force between bodies. Equation: Magnitude = (strength * bodyMass1 * bodyMass2) / distance ^ exponent.

member.summary: Get the current gear.

member.summary: Return the steer angle of the wheels.

member.summary: Return the rotation angle of the wheels about the axis of rolling rotation.

member.summary: Return the suspension jounce of the wheels.

member.summary: Return the longitudinal slip of the wheels.

member.summary: Return the lateral slip of the wheels.

member.summary: Return the friction applied to the wheels.

member.name: M:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.AreWheelsInAir
member.summary: Test if wheels are off the ground.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.DifferentialType
member.summary: Type of differential.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.DifferentialFrontRearSplit
member.summary: Ratio of torque split between front and rear (more than 0.5 means more to front, less than 0.5 means more to rear). Only applied to LimitedSlipAllWheelDrive and OpenAllWheelDrive differential types.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.DifferentialFrontLeftRightSplit
member.summary: Ratio of torque split between front-left and front-right (more than 0.5 means more to front-left, less than 0.5 means more to front-right). Only applied to LimitedSlipAllWheelDrive, OpenAllWheelDrive and LimitedSlipFrontWheelDrive differential types.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.DifferentialRearLeftRightSplit
member.summary: Ratio of torque split between rear-left and rear-right (more than 0.5 means more to rear-left, less than 0.5 means more to rear-right). Only applied to LimitedSlipAllWheelDrive, OpenAllWheelDrive and LimitedSlipRearWheelDrive differential types.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.DifferentialCenterBias
member.summary: Maximum allowed ratio of average front wheel rotation speed and rear wheel rotation speeds. Only applied to LimitedSlipAllWheelDrive differential types.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.DifferentialFrontBias
member.summary: Maximum allowed ratio of front-left and front-right wheel rotation speeds. Only applied to LimitedSlipAllWheelDrive and LimitedSlipFrontWheelDrive differential types.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.DifferentialRearBias
member.summary: Maximum allowed ratio of rear-left and rear-right wheel rotation speeds. Only applied to LimitedSlipAllWheelDrive and LimitedSlipRearWheelDrive differential types.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.EnginePeakTorque
member.summary: Maximum torque available to apply to the engine, specified in Nm. Please note that to optimize the implementation the engine has a hard-coded inertia of 1kgm^2. As a consequence the magnitude of the engine's angular acceleration is exactly equal to the magnitude of the torque driving the engine. To simulate engines with different inertias (!=1kgm^2) adjust either the entries of EngineTorqueCurve or EnginePeakTorque accordingly.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.EngineMaxRPM
member.summary: Maximum rotation speed of the engine, specified in revolutions per minute (RPM).

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.EngineDampingRateFullThrottle
member.summary: Damping rate of engine in s^-1 when full throttle is applied. Damping rate applied at run-time is an interpolation between EngineDampingRateZeroThrottleClutchEngaged and EngineDampingRateFullThrottle if the clutch is engaged. If the clutch is disengaged (in neutral gear) the damping rate applied at run-time is an interpolation between EngineDampingRateZeroThrottleClutchDisengaged and EngineDampingRateFullThrottle.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.EngineDampingRateZeroThrottleClutchEngaged
member.summary: Damping rate of engine in s^-1 at zero throttle when the clutch is engaged. Damping rate applied at run-time is an interpolation between EngineDampingRateZeroThrottleClutchEngaged and EngineDampingRateFullThrottle if the clutch is engaged. If the clutch is disengaged (in neutral gear) the damping rate applied at run-time is an interpolation between EngineDampingRateZeroThrottleClutchDisengaged and EngineDampingRateFullThrottle.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.EngineDampingRateZeroThrottleClutchDisengaged
member.summary: Damping rate of engine in s^-1 at zero throttle when the clutch is disengaged (in neutral gear). Damping rate applied at run-time is an interpolation between EngineDampingRateZeroThrottleClutchEngaged and EngineDampingRateFullThrottle if the clutch is engaged. If the clutch is disengaged (in neutral gear) the damping rate applied at run-time is an interpolation between EngineDampingRateZeroThrottleClutchDisengaged and EngineDampingRateFullThrottle.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.EngineTorqueCurve
member.summary: Graph of normalized torque (torque/maxTorque) against normalized engine revs (revs/maxRevs).

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.Gears
member.summary: The list of gears.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.GearsSwitchTime
member.summary: Time it takes to switch gear, specified in seconds.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.ClutchStrength
member.summary: Strength of clutch. Torque generated by clutch is proportional to the clutch strength and the velocity difference between the engine speed and the speed of the driven wheels after accounting for the gear ratio.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.AckermannSteerAccuracy
member.summary: Accuracy of Ackermann steer calculation. Accuracy with value 0.0f results in no Ackermann steer-correction. Accuracy with value 1.0 results in perfect Ackermann steer-correction.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.EngineTorqueCurveItem.NormalizedTorque
member.summary: Normalised torque (torque/maxTorque).

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.EngineTorqueCurveItem.NormalizedRev
member.summary: Normalised engine revs (revs/maxRevs).

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.GearItem.Number
member.summary: The number of the gear. Set -1 to for reverse gear, set 0 for neutral gear.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.GearItem.Ratio
member.summary: Gear ratio.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.WheelDampingRate
member.summary: Damping rate applied to wheel.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.WheelMaxBrakeTorque
member.summary: Max brake torque that can be applied to wheel, specified in Nm.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.WheelMaxHandBrakeTorque
member.summary: Max handbrake torque that can be applied to wheel, specified in Nm.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.WheelMaxSteer
member.summary: Max steer angle that can be achieved by the wheel, specified in degrees.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.WheelToeAngle
member.summary: Wheel toe angle, specified in degrees.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.SuspensionSpringStrength
member.summary: Spring strength of suspension unit, specified in N m^-1.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.SuspensionSpringDamperRate
member.summary: Spring damper rate of suspension unit, specified in s^-1.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.SuspensionMaxCompression
member.summary: Maximum compression allowed by suspension spring, specified in m.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.SuspensionMaxDroop
member.summary: Maximum elongation allowed by suspension spring, specified in m.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.SuspensionSprungMassCoefficient
member.summary: Mass of vehicle that is supported by suspension spring, specified in coefficient of the chassis mass.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.SuspensionForceApplicationPointOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the application point of the suspension force of the suspension of the wheel. Specified relative to the centre of the wheel.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.TireForceApplicationPointOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the application point of the tire force of the tire of the wheel. Specified relative to the centre of the wheel.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.TireLatStiffX
member.summary: Tire lateral stiffness is typically a graph of tire load that has linear behaviour near zero load and flattens at large loads. mLatStiffX describes the minimum normalised load (load/restLoad) that gives a flat lateral stiffness response.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.TireLatStiffY
member.summary: Tire lateral stiffness is a graph of tire load that has linear behavior near zero load and flattens at large loads. TireLatStiffY describes the maximum possible lateral stiffness divided by the rest tire load, specified in "per radian".

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.TireLongitudinalStiffnessPerUnitGravity
member.summary: Tire Longitudinal stiffness per unit longitudinal slip per unit gravity, specified in N per radian per unit gravitational acceleration Longitudinal stiffness of the tire per unit longitudinal slip is calculated as gravitationalAcceleration * TireLongitudinalStiffnessPerUnitGravity.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.TireCamberStiffness
member.summary: Camber stiffness, specified in N per radian.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.FrictionVsSlipGraphZeroLongitudinalSlip
member.summary: Graph of friction vs longitudinal slip with 3 points. This is the friction available at zero longitudinal slip.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.FrictionVsSlipGraphLongitudinalSlipWithMaximumFriction
member.summary: Graph of friction vs longitudinal slip with 3 points. This is the value of longitudinal slip with maximum friction.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.FrictionVsSlipGraphMaximumFriction
member.summary: Graph of friction vs longitudinal slip with 3 points. This is the maximum friction.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.FrictionVsSlipGraphEndPointOfGraph
member.summary: Graph of friction vs longitudinal slip with 3 points. This is the end point of the graph.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.WheelItem.FrictionVsSlipGraphValueOfFrictionForSlipsGreaterThanEndPointOfGraph
member.summary: Graph of friction vs longitudinal slip with 3 points. This is the value of friction for slips greater than end point of the graph.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.TireFrictionMultiplierItem.SurfaceMaterialName
member.summary: Gets or sets physical material of the surface. If you specify an empty string, the value will be used for all materials which are not specified in this list.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.PhysicsVehicle.InitDataClass.TireFrictionMultiplierItem.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets friction value.

member.summary: Fall rate of steer analog value if digital value is 0.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.ForceType.Local
member.summary: Apply a force in a direction relative to the Body's local coordinate system.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.ForceType.Global
member.summary: Apply a force in a direction relative to the global coordinate system.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.ForceType.LocalTorque
member.summary: Apply a torque with the axis specified relative to the Body's local coordinate system.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.ForceType.GlobalTorque
member.summary: Apply a torque with the axis specified relative to global coordinate system.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.ForceType.LocalAtLocalPos
member.summary: Apply a force at a position relative to the Body's local coordinate system in a direction relative to the Body's local coordinate system.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.ForceType.LocalAtGlobalPos
member.summary: Apply a force at a position relative to the global coordinate system in a direction relative to the Body's local coordinate system.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.ForceType.GlobalAtLocalPos
member.summary: Apply a force at a position relative to the Body's local coordinate system in a direction relative to the global coordinate system.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.ForceType.GlobalAtGlobalPos
member.summary: Apply a force at a position relative to the global coordinate system in a direction relative to the global coordinate system.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.UniversalJoint.Anchor
member.summary: Specifies the point where the two bodies are attached.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.UniversalJoint.Axis1
member.summary: Specifies first rotational axis this joint.

member.name: P:Engine.PhysicsSystem.UniversalJoint.Axis2
member.summary: Specifies second rotational axis this joint.

member.name: T:Engine.PhysicsSystem.UniversalJoint.PhysX_Drive
member.summary: Used to specify which axes of a joint are driven.
member.remarks: Each drive is an implicit force-limited damped spring: force = spring * (target position - position) + damping * (targetVelocity - velocity) Alternatively, the spring may be configured to generate a specified acceleration instead of a force. A linear axis is affected by drive only if the corresponding drive flag is set. There are two possible models for angular drive: swing/twist, which may be used to drive one or more angular degrees of freedom, or slerp, which may only be used to drive all three angular degrees simultaneously.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.UniversalJoint.PhysX_Drive.X
member.summary: Drive along the X-axis.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.UniversalJoint.PhysX_Drive.Y
member.summary: Drive along the Y-axis.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.UniversalJoint.PhysX_Drive.Z
member.summary: Drive along the Z-axis.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.UniversalJoint.PhysX_Drive.Swing
member.summary: Drive of displacement from the X-axis.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.UniversalJoint.PhysX_Drive.Twist
member.summary: Drive of the displacement around the X-axis.

member.name: F:Engine.PhysicsSystem.UniversalJoint.PhysX_Drive.Slerp
member.summary: Drive of all three angular degrees along a SLERP-path.
